alert.note: Alert for Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains; Southwest Big Horn Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 29 at 3:38PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Hot Springs County through 415 PM MDT... At 336 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles south of Hamilton Dome, or 14 miles west of Thermopolis, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Thermopolis and Hot Springs State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains; Southwest Big Horn Basin
